data.text: I have had fatigue failure on an aluminium chainstay. I've had rust failure on steel frame. I've snapped aluminium cranks. I've had titanium seat rails break and steel nuts snap. I've never had carbon just break, and I ride carbon more than any other material. Closest would be metal parts breaking that were integrated into a carbon frame, if that counts, I have a carbon road bike which uses an aluminium sleeve for the seatpost and the aluminium cracked. Never the carbon itself. My touring bike is titanium but carbon fork, I also have had >10 year old carbon road bikes, MTB and cross. It's extremely strong stuff. A lot stronger than other materials.
